trans-unit.source: title: 'Get the user's location' description: Find the user's location and respond to changes in location.
trans-unit.target: title: 'Get the user's location' description: Find the user's location and respond to changes in location.

trans-unit.source: Access to the user's location is managed by privacy settings in the Settings app.
trans-unit.target: Access to the user's location is managed by privacy settings in the Settings app.

trans-unit.source: This topic also shows how to check if your app has permission to access the user's location.
trans-unit.target: This topic also shows how to check if your app has permission to access the user's location.

trans-unit.source: ms.assetid: 24DC9A41-8CC1-48B0-BC6D-24BF571AFCC8
trans-unit.target: ms.assetid: 24DC9A41-8CC1-48B0-BC6D-24BF571AFCC8

trans-unit.source: Get the user's location
trans-unit.target: Get the user's location

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Find the user's location and respond to changes in location.
trans-unit.target: Find the user's location and respond to changes in location.

trans-unit.source: Access to the user's location is managed by privacy settings in the Settings app.
trans-unit.target: Access to the user's location is managed by privacy settings in the Settings app.

trans-unit.source: This topic also shows how to check if your app has permission to access the user's location.
trans-unit.target: This topic also shows how to check if your app has permission to access the user's location.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To learn more about accessing the user's location in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To learn more about accessing the user's location in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

trans-unit.source: Enable the location capability
trans-unit.target: Enable the location capability

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click **package.appxmanifest** and select the **Capabilities** tab.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click **package.appxmanifest** and select the **Capabilities** tab.

trans-unit.source: In the **Capabilities** list, select the **Capabilities** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the **Capabilities** list, select the **Capabilities** tab.

trans-unit.source: This adds the `Location` device capability to the package manifest file.
trans-unit.target: This adds the `Location` device capability to the package manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Get the current location
trans-unit.target: Get the current location

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to detect the user's geographic location using APIs in the [**Windows.Devices.Geolocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225603) namespace.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to detect the user's geographic location using APIs in the [**Windows.Devices.Geolocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225603) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Request access to the user's location
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Request access to the user's location

trans-unit.source: **Important** You must request access to the user's location by using the [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method before attempting to access the user's location.
trans-unit.target: **Important** You must request access to the user's location by using the [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method before attempting to access the user's location.

trans-unit.source: You must call the **RequestAccessAsync** method from the UI thread and your app must be in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: You must call the **RequestAccessAsync** method from the UI thread and your app must be in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Your app will not be able to access the user's location information until after the user grants permission to your app.
trans-unit.target: Your app will not be able to access the user's location information until after the user grants permission to your app.

trans-unit.source: The [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method prompts the user for permission to access their location.
trans-unit.target: The [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method prompts the user for permission to access their location.

trans-unit.source: The user is only prompted once (per app).
trans-unit.target: The user is only prompted once (per app).

trans-unit.source: After the first time they grant or deny permission, this method no longer prompts the user for permission.
trans-unit.target: After the first time they grant or deny permission, this method no longer prompts the user for permission.

trans-unit.source: To help the user change location permissions after they've been prompted, we recommend that you provide a link to the location settings as demonstrated later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: To help the user change location permissions after they've been prompted, we recommend that you provide a link to the location settings as demonstrated later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Get the user's location and register for changes in location permissions
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Get the user's location and register for changes in location permissions

trans-unit.source: The [**GetGeopositionAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh973536) method performs a one-time reading of the current location.
trans-unit.target: The [**GetGeopositionAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh973536) method performs a one-time reading of the current location.

trans-unit.source: Here, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.
trans-unit.target: Here, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.

trans-unit.source: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code creates a [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object, registers for changes in location permissions, and requests the user's location.
trans-unit.target: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code creates a [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object, registers for changes in location permissions, and requests the user's location.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Handle changes in location permissions
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Handle changes in location permissions

trans-unit.source: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object triggers the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225542) event to indicate that the user's location settings changed.
trans-unit.target: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object triggers the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225542) event to indicate that the user's location settings changed.

trans-unit.source: That event passes the corresponding status via the argument's **Status** property (of type [**PositionStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225599)).
trans-unit.target: That event passes the corresponding status via the argument's **Status** property (of type [**PositionStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225599)).

trans-unit.source: Note that this method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.
trans-unit.target: Note that this method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.

trans-unit.source: Respond to location updates
trans-unit.target: Respond to location updates

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to use the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event to receive updates of the user's location over a period of time.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to use the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event to receive updates of the user's location over a period of time.

trans-unit.source: Because the user could revoke access to location at any time, it's important call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) and use the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225542) event as shown in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Because the user could revoke access to location at any time, it's important call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) and use the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225542) event as shown in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: This section assumes that you've already enabled the location capability and called [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) from the UI thread of your foreground app.
trans-unit.target: This section assumes that you've already enabled the location capability and called [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) from the UI thread of your foreground app.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Define the report interval and register for location updates
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Define the report interval and register for location updates

trans-unit.source: In this example, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.

trans-unit.source: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code creates a [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object, specifies the tracking type, and registers for location updates.
trans-unit.target: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code creates a [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object, specifies the tracking type, and registers for location updates.

trans-unit.source: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object can trigger the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event based on a change in position (distance-based tracking) or a change in time (periodic-based tracking).
trans-unit.target: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object can trigger the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event based on a change in position (distance-based tracking) or a change in time (periodic-based tracking).

trans-unit.source: For distance-based tracking, set the [**MovementThreshold**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225539) property.
trans-unit.target: For distance-based tracking, set the [**MovementThreshold**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225539) property.

trans-unit.source: For periodic-based tracking, set the [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225541) property.
trans-unit.target: For periodic-based tracking, set the [**ReportInterval**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225541) property.

trans-unit.source: If neither property is set, a position is returned every 1 second (equivalent to `ReportInterval = 1000`).
trans-unit.target: If neither property is set, a position is returned every 1 second (equivalent to `ReportInterval = 1000`).

trans-unit.source: Here, a 2 second (`ReportInterval = 2000`) report interval is used.
trans-unit.target: Here, a 2 second (`ReportInterval = 2000`) report interval is used.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Handle location updates
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Handle location updates

trans-unit.source: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object triggers the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event to indicate that the user's location changed or time has passed, depending on how you've configured it.
trans-unit.target: The [**Geolocator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225534) object triggers the [**PositionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225540) event to indicate that the user's location changed or time has passed, depending on how you've configured it.

trans-unit.source: That event passes the corresponding location via the argument's **Position** property (of type [**Geoposition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225543)).
trans-unit.target: That event passes the corresponding location via the argument's **Position** property (of type [**Geoposition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225543)).

trans-unit.source: In this example, the method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.

trans-unit.source: Change the location privacy settings
trans-unit.target: Change the location privacy settings

trans-unit.source: If the location privacy settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend that you provide a convenient link to the **location privacy settings** in the **Settings** app.
trans-unit.target: If the location privacy settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend that you provide a convenient link to the **location privacy settings** in the **Settings** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a Hyperlink control is used navigate to the `ms-settings:privacy-location` URI.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a Hyperlink control is used navigate to the `ms-settings:privacy-location` URI.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, your app can call the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch the **Settings** app from code.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, your app can call the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch the **Settings** app from code.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228342).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228342).

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot your app
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot your app

trans-unit.source: Before your app can access the user's location, **Location** must be enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can access the user's location, **Location** must be enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: In the **Settings** app, check that the following **location privacy settings** are turned on:
trans-unit.target: In the **Settings** app, check that the following **location privacy settings** are turned on:

trans-unit.source: **Location for this device...** is turned **on** (not applicable in Windows 10 Mobile)
trans-unit.target: **Location for this device...** is turned **on** (not applicable in Windows 10 Mobile)

trans-unit.source: The location services setting, **Location**, is turned **on**
trans-unit.target: The location services setting, **Location**, is turned **on**

trans-unit.source: Under **Choose apps that can use your location**, your app is set to **on**
trans-unit.target: Under **Choose apps that can use your location**, your app is set to **on**
